Package leitej.util.data

Class TimeTriggerImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • leitej.util.data.TimeTriggerImpl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, TimeTrigger
    public final class TimeTriggerImpl
extends java.lang.Object
implements TimeTrigger
    This class makes use of Calendar to calculate the periods.
    Author:
    Julio Leite
    See Also:
    Calendar, Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • TimeTriggerImpl

        public TimeTriggerImpl()
        Creates a new instance of DateTimer. Without steps.

      • TimeTriggerImpl

        public TimeTriggerImpl​(DateFieldEnum periodType,
                       int periodFactor)
        Creates a new instance of DateTimer.
        Parameters:
        periodType - defines the type of period (ex: MINUTE, MONTH)
        periodFactor - defines the factor for the period that determines the step

      • TimeTriggerImpl

        public TimeTriggerImpl​(DateFieldEnum periodType,
                       int periodFactor,
                       int numRepetitions)
        Creates a new instance of DateTimer.
        Parameters:
        periodType - defines the type of period (ex: MINUTE, MONTH)
        periodFactor - defines the factor for the period that determines the step
        numRepetitions - number of steps to give

      • TimeTriggerImpl

        public TimeTriggerImpl​(DateFieldEnum periodType,
                       int periodFactor,
                       java.util.Date finalize)
        Creates a new instance of DateTimer.
        Parameters:
        periodType - defines the type of period (ex: MINUTE, MONTH)
        periodFactor - defines the factor for the period that determines the step
        finalize - Date that determines the end step

      • TimeTriggerImpl

        public TimeTriggerImpl​(java.util.Date initiate,
                       DateFieldEnum periodType,
                       int periodFactor,
                       int numRepetitions,
                       java.util.Date finalize)
        Creates a new instance of DateTimer.
        Parameters:
        initiate - Date that determines the start step
        periodType - defines the type of period (ex: MINUTE, MONTH)
        periodFactor - defines the factor for the period that determines the step
        numRepetitions - number of steps to give
        finalize - Date that determines the end step
